description.narrative: The development intervention's overall objective is to help develop a plural civil society populated with healthy and transparent well-governed, rule-based and mission-oriented CSOs, where CDRL/Media Law Institute is one.

Sedan 2010 har Sveriges ambassad i Kiev implementerat ett kärnstödsprogram för ett antal utvalda inflytelserika civilsamhälleorganisationer in Ukraina. Media Law Institute har ansökt om att delta i detta program. MLI har gått igenom en etablerad process som började med en systembaserad revision, genomförd av konsultföretaget PM-SDA konsortium. För att kunna få kärnstöd reommenderas MLI att implementera 16 prioriterade rekommendationer, inklusive uppdatering av den strategiska planen med inkluderade SMART indikatorer. MLI bör också utveckla, revidera eller förbättra sina interna riktlinjer/policy för revision, upphandling och anti-korruption, samp eftersträva att strama åt sin interna finansiella kotroll. Den totala insatsen uppgård till SEK 10 780 000. Insatsen består av 2 faser: det forberedande stödet (aktivitetsperiod juli - december 2013) och det efterföljande kärnstödet med aktivitetsperiod till den 31 december 2016 - villkorat till förbättringsprogrammet. Budgeten inkluderar en första utbetalning (det förberedande stödet) till MLI av SEK 780 000 efter avtalets undertecknande. Ytterligare tre utbetalningar planeras som kärnstöd. Beloppet för det institutionella stödet uppgår till SEK 10 000 000 över tre och ett halvt år. Mellan fas ett/förberedande stödet, som går ut på att implementera förbätringsplanen, och fas två/kärnstödet kommer Sida/ambassaden att verifiera arbetet genom oberoende expertis sombekräfar implementeringen av alla 16 prioriterade rekommendationerna innan Sida/ambassadengodkänner fas 2,kärnstöd. Under fas 2 kommer svenska medel att stödja implementeringen av MLIs strategi för att uppnå de planerade resultaten såsom de definierats i resultatramverket (RAF). Alla nödvändiga förändringar av budgeten och det utarbetandenresultatramverket kommer att görasefter fas 1. Avtalsändringen bör återspegla dessa föråndringar.

This core support is given to CDRL/MLI as part of the Sida Programme of Core Support to Ukraine's strategic NGOs.The project is designed for 4 years, the first is dedicated to fixing the priority internal organisational systems to manage the institutional support in a responsible manner.

participating-org.narrative: CDRL/Centre for Democracy and Rule of Law

description.narrative:
Strategic Goal 1. Support and protection of the media environment CDRL has achieved key indicators for the expected outcomes under this sub-objective, as planned in the Result Assessment Framework for 2016, with several reasoned postponements: - The statute of Public Joint Stock Company “National Public Television and Radio Company of Ukraine” has been approved by the Government enabling the formation of the legal entity of public broadcaster - Advancing in implementation of the de-statisation of the print press law with CDRL inputs - Adoption of the new law on audio-visual media services was postponed for the next year, as it has to take into account the evolving EU framework; CDRL lawyers joined the task force on in the parliamentary committee For the media coverage during elections, CDRL and its partners in RPR postponed advocacy of regulations closer to elections, so CDRL delivered analytic on and focused on such pressing issues as counteracting adoption of laws having a chilling effect for media. SUB-OBJECTIVE 1.2. EDUCATION IN THE MEDIA SPHERE CDRL has met indicators for the expected outcomes under this sub-objective, as planned in the Result Assessment Framework, specifically: - High evaluation rate of its annual 2016 Summer School by participants – 9,74 out of 10 points; - Successful gaining of the knowledge of media law, access to information rules, and media coverage of courts by over 140 trainees of CDRL `s distant-learning courses; - Deepening of the knowledge of media law by lecturers of journalistic faculties. SUB-OBJECTIVE 1.3. INDEPENDENT MEDIA COUNCIL: CDRL has met indicators for the expected outcomes under this sub-objective, as planned in the Result Assessment Framework, specifically: - The Independent Media Council has become an influential media self-regulatory body that rendered 11 decisions, which are often taken into account by the National Council for TV and Radio Broadcasting and by the parties to dispute - The national regulator relied on recommendations by the Council Strategic Goal 2. Support and Implement Civic Initiatives SUB-OBJECTIVE 2.1 REANIMATION PACKAGE OF REFORMS CDRL fulfilled key indicators for the expected outcomes under this sub-objective, as planned in the Result Assessment Framework, speifically: - The developed RPR coalition`s Strategy for 2016-17 gained support of most of RPR members - CDRL ensured sustainable operational and financial support for the RPR coalition work 29% Ukrainians know about the RPR, according to the latest public poll of December 2016 that was devoted to reforms in the country. SUB-OBJECTIVE 2.2 CHESNO MOVEMENT CDRL has fulfilled those indicators defined for the expected outcomes under this sub-objective in the Result Assessment Framework and other important that emerged along: - for precluding dishonest judges from life-long approval – 23 judges out of 38 were dismissed for unlawful decisions during Euromaidan and ungrounded release of top criminals, yet CDRL activists held five direct actions asking the Parliament to dismiss 10% of old judges; - the team decided not to register the law on cancelling excessive privileges for MPs, just made a research on, but channelled its efforts into monitoring of the large-scale judicial reform and profiling of every judge, starting with building of network of 23 coordinators in different regions. SUB-OBJECTIVE 2.3 TOBACO FREE KYIV CDRL has partially fulfilled two indicators defined for the expected outcomes under this sub-objective in the Result Assessment Framework: - a draft law on tobacco products display and smoke free public places was developed and registered at the Parliament - for ensuring of abidance by law on tobacco advertising ban in Kyiv: there is no direct advertising, but remains a disguised one by means of sales promotion at 81% points of sales – actually sellers are evading the law No 3778 due to gaps in regulation, which we are planning to eliminate. Open Parliament CDRL has met an indicator in the expected outcomes under this sub-objective in the Result Assessment Framework: - diligent implementation of the Open Parliament Action Plan is ensured in the part where CDRL is a responsible monitoring CSO, yet meeting with lack of political will to execute some issues. Strategic Goal 3. Implement Anticorruption Initiatives SUB-OBJECTIVE 3.1 Lab of Active Citizens CDRL has fulfilled key indicators in the expected outcomes under this sub-objective in the Result Assessment Framework: - over 30 anticorruption campaigns/investigations/press articles have emerged as a follow-up of CDRL `s relevant trainings in most of regions of Ukraine; - a network of over 750 activists from 16 cities stand ready to get involved into fight for integrity and good governance, started their own civic initiatives. SUB-OBJECTIVE 3.2 Right to Access Information (RTI)
CDRL has achieved indicators of the expected outcomes under this sub-objective in the Result Assessment Framework, with one reasoned alteration: - The team influenced the practice applied in public bodies in terms of receiving public data by providing to the Ombudsman Office 5 expert opinions on access to information, as the relevant project ended up in June 2016, nevertheless CEDEM issued 2 handbooks on access – one devoted to recommendations to the Public Information Administrators and another one on contesting reluctance to provide documents in cases on access to public information. - CDRL contributed to raise of accountability of public bodies by winning 4 cases on the right to access public information.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
